ben-the-muster.name: Ben "the Muster"
ben-the-muster.description: Captain of the campaign's starting sloop (name not established yet), commanding about 40 crew. He is known as a charismatic recruiter and a feared organizer, a reputation that attracts both allies and trouble. His name draws attention openly, even in pirate spaces like Sablemarket Cay.
ben-the-muster.history:
- Ben "the Muster" is the campaign's captain.
- Ben commands a small, fast sloop.
- Ben's crew is approximately 40 people.
- A plainclothes Navy lieutenant asks publicly for Ben's current berth at Sablemarket Cay.
- Bounties are rising, and the Company is buying informants in Free Harbors.

joryn-gullknife-sable.name: Captain Joryn "Gullknife" Sable
joryn-gullknife-sable.description: A rival captain and duelist associated with the Rival Captains known as the Blackwake Circle. He treats competition as a public game, watching for chances to counter or undercut Ben. At Sablemarket Cay, he is present at the rumor auction and tracks Ben's moves closely.
joryn-gullknife-sable.history:
- Joryn "Gullknife" Sable is a rival captain.
- Gullknife is associated with the Rival Captains (the Blackwake Circle).
- Gullknife is at Sablemarket Cay during the auction of rumors.
- Gullknife smiles at Ben from the front row as bidding begins on the Sunken Crown chart.

lysa-quell.name: Factor Lysa Quell
lysa-quell.description: An Eastwater Company factor with a reputation for being polite, professional, and dangerous. She offers work that is designed to create dependence and narrow a crew's options. So far, her influence reaches the crew indirectly through Company couriers and contracts.
lysa-quell.history:
- Lysa Quell is a factor of the Eastwater Company.
- A Company courier says Quell will "buy your next week - exclusive" at Sablemarket Cay.
- Quell has not appeared directly in the story yet.

alaric-vane.name: Commodore Alaric Vane
alaric-vane.description: A senior face of the Crown Navy described as ruthless. He is positioned as a major threat whose interest in Ben is personal, not merely professional. His broader operations and current location are not established yet.
alaric-vane.history:
- Alaric Vane is a commodore in the Crown Navy.
- Vane wants Ben's head for a past humiliation.

mirelda-soot.name: Lt. Mirelda Soot
mirelda-soot.description: A Crown Navy lieutenant known for being a clever hunter. She is characterized as someone who hunts by ledgers rather than rumors, implying a methodical, paper-trail approach. Her current involvement in the opening scene is not established yet.
mirelda-soot.history:
- Mirelda Soot is a lieutenant in the Crown Navy.
- Soot is described as a clever hunter.
- Soot hunts by ledgers, not rumors.

old-salt-merrow.name: Councilor "Old Salt" Merrow
old-salt-merrow.description: A leading face of the Free Harbors League and a pragmatist focused on keeping sanctuary running. He represents the League's reality that safety has costs and politics. His specific actions in the current storyline are not established yet.
old-salt-merrow.history:
- "Old Salt" Merrow is a councilor in the Free Harbors League.
- Merrow is described as a pragmatist.
- Merrow's direct role in current events is not established yet.

nemi-vale.name: Arbitrator Nemi Vale
nemi-vale.description: A Free Harbors League enforcer described as a code-focused official who hates unpaid debts. She embodies the League's ability to make sanctuary conditional through rules and consequences. Her direct involvement with Ben's crew is not established yet.
nemi-vale.history:
- Nemi Vale is an arbitrator in the Free Harbors League.
- Vale is described as a code-enforcer.
- Vale hates unpaid debts.
- Vale's direct role in current events is not established yet.

sister-brine.name: Sister Brine
sister-brine.description: A named face of the Tideborn Covenant, presented as a priestess who trades in vows. She is tied to the setting's oath-and-price sea-witchcraft and its lasting debts and marks. Her actions and relationship to the crew are not established yet.
sister-brine.history:
- Sister Brine is a face of the Tideborn Covenant.
- Sister Brine is described as a priestess who trades in vows.
- Sister Brine's direct role in current events is not established yet.
